title: Is every reaction between two elements a redox reaction? - Quora

response.answer_text: Absolutely, The every reaction between two elements are Redox reaction. Unlike for compounds where certain reactions are not Redox reaction. Eg, Neutralization reaction. In order to occur Redox reaction the reactant must obey the following factors: The donation and receiving of electron must occur together between elementsThere must be change in the Oxidation Number between both elementsIn fact There must be both Oxidation and Reuction react together spontaneously !.

Yes, a reaction between two elements is always a redox reaction. Such a reaction is usually termed a combination reaction or synthesis. For instance, even in a reaction between two highly electronegative nonmetals like nitrogen and oxygen to form nitric oxide, nitrogen is oxidised to +2 state and oxygen gets reduced to -2 state. When the reaction is between one metal and a nonmetal, the former invariably gets oxidised and the nonmetal gets reduced.
Between two elements meaning like sodium metal and chlorine gas? Or are you referring to any general reaction?As for the former, it would be a redox reaction, but not all reactions are redox.
